snippet: For months, residents have been caught between the Taliban, militias and government forces; a devastating earthquake is adding to the misery.

byline.contributor: Reporting was contributed by Salman Masood from Islamabad, Pakistan; Jawad Sukhanyar from Kabul; Najim Rahim from Kunduz, Afghanistan; Khalid Alokozay from Jalalabad, Afghanistan; and an employee of The New York Times from Badakhshan Province, Afghanistan.

abstract: Powerful earthquake in northern Afghanistan adds to woes of residents caught in midst of fighting between Taliban and government forces; aid groups have been hindered by remoteness of area and fear of Taliban.
lead_paragraph: For months, residents have been caught between the Taliban, militias and government forces; a devastating earthquake is adding to the misery.

headline.print_headline: For War-Weary Afghans, Earthquake Is Simply One More Serving of Misery
headline.main: For War-Weary Afghanistan, Earthquake Is Just One More Serving of Misery
